title: Fails on (some) valid input data
body:
KvarQ failed to scan some vaild fastqs 

[2014-10-16 14:14:57,638] -INFO- cli.py:477(main) :: loaded testsuite "example" from "/home/phelimb/tools/kvarq-master/testsuites/MTBC/example.py"
[2014-10-16 14:14:57,655] -INFO- cli.py:477(main) :: loaded testsuite "phylo" from "/home/phelimb/tools/kvarq-master/testsuites/MTBC/phylo.py"
[2014-10-16 14:14:57,666] -INFO- cli.py:477(main) :: loaded testsuite "resistance" from "/home/phelimb/tools/kvarq-master/testsuites/MTBC/resistance.py"
[2014-10-16 14:14:57,671] -INFO- cli.py:477(main) :: loaded testsuite "spoligo" from "/home/phelimb/tools/kvarq-master/testsuites/MTBC/spoligo.py"
[2014-10-16 14:14:57,916] -INFO- fastq.py:146(**init**) :: gzipped fastq : readlength=? records_approx=? dQ=0 variants=['Sanger']
[2014-10-16 14:14:57,917] -INFO- cli.py:86(scan) :: scanning 
[===================== 99% ====================>] 1m 0s / 1m 2s   [2014-10-16 14:15:57,981] -ERROR- cli.py:161(scan) :: could not scan 
file : record must start with '@' (and not 'F') fpos=984389052 [cli.py:101 -> /python2.7/site-packages/kvarq-0.12.2-py2.7-linux-x86_64.egg/kvarq/analyse.py:322]

grep '^F' fastq_file returns nothing so it doesn't look like there's any line in the file that starts with an F. 

fpos=984389052 is out of 984389772 total bytes. so 99.9999% of the way through the file. 

I've manually checked the fastq and the last record looks fine. I've also fully parsed the file with BioPython and with another fq parser without error. 

The last record looks like this. 
!!!!CDCF8:DCDGGDFEGF-EDHGH?GGFDHEFBEDIAFBFEGFDGEEGGG7GHEFHGFE.EDECE8FGFDG@GFBHCFCFFCFDGF=GC,FE+>E@DF
@HS22_09330:8:2316:21315:56524#77
NNNNTCCCTTTTCTCAACATTGCCGAAGACCACCTGTATGGGGAGGCAACGATGGCCGAATCAACCGGGCCCAAGCCCCGGGGGCGGCCCGCGGGGGGGG
+
!!!!7?-?(-,?EA?6BF?F9EE68,,DCBB9FB7?,,,,C,''+-D''78-7D>D+,8''(.-E#7-6'C,,-7,7,'E66',7,,557C,6,HFE'&4

This issue does not appear on every sample, only a few files.

title: Fails if Qscore>=50
body:
I'm not sure what the fastq specs are for illumina 1.8 but I think they can have quality scores > 41. 

A quote from wikipedia "For processed reads, scores may be even higher. For example, quality values of 45 are observed in reads from Illumina's Long Read Sequencing Service (previously Moleculo)." http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FASTQ_format

Files have failed as they have quality scores of 50. Although this is outside the expected range they don't violate the file format specs which I think is 0 - 62 http://wiki.christophchamp.com/index.php/FASTQ_format so I'm not sure if failing is the ideal behaviour.

title: engine.py
body:
I could not locate this module in the kvarq/kvarq directory. I think it is required by both the cli.py and analyse.py scripts. 

Maybe I am doing something wrong, please advice.

Thanks,
Matthew.

title: PE fastq-file recognition *_R2*
body:
Newer Illumina PE paired end files often have __R1_ and __R2_ for the two paired fastq-files. So far kvarq recognizes automatically "_1.fastq" and "_2.fastq".

Examples:
ABCDS_genoscreen_genoscreen_2013-10-31_101bp_R1-01.fastq.gz
ABCDS_genoscreen_genoscreen_2013-10-31_101bp_R2-01.fastq.gz

BSSE_QGF_22111_140729_D00535_0017_BH9YKEADXX_1_TCCTGAG-AAGGAGT_L001_R1_001_D1_G01938.fastq.gz
BSSE_QGF_22111_140729_D00535_0017_BH9YKEADXX_1_TCCTGAG-AAGGAGT_L001_R2_001_D1_G01938.fastq.gz

title: fastq-format quality encoding exceeding scale
body:
> [2015-07-03 10:02:36,191] -ERROR- cli.py:75(scan) :: cannot open file /path/SRR671719_1.fastq.gz : could not find any suitable fastq vendor variant

Reason: fastq-quality values larger than 40? Reads have „i“ - does that quality score, exceeding 40, break the recognition?

Example read:

@SRR671719.1 FCC02TBACXX:2:1101:1248:2210/1
TGGGCAACGGGGTGTGCGTTCGGCGGCTGGGGTCGCGCGACCGGTCGCAGCACTTCGGGCAATGCGTCAAACCCTGGGAACACGTCAACC
+
bbbeeeeeggggbffghhiihiiiiiiggeec`acaUVOOVY_TTTTTTLW[`bbaacZV_^bbaWWVO]YW^[[`a^^V[[[`accc_

Looks like Illumina format:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FASTQ_format#Encoding

title: Error on MacOS
body: The program does not open. Just show a window with the options: console and terminate.
